job description:
The Healthcare Data Analyst will work alongside our IT Analytical Team, providing critical data analysis/administration on client projects involving large sets of data, including massive databases. As our analyst/administrator, you will play a key role interpreting and comparing data, cross-referencing databases to find hits, and extracting data to support decision making, report findings, and discover additional opportunities to assist clients.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Perform complex analytics on large datasets- Create and maintain interactive dashboards- Perform ad-hoc queries and data analysis- Act as a steward over data integrity, ensuring data is accurate and up-to-date- Document code and business logic

    Required Skills:
  • 1+ years hands-on experience in a language such as ACL, R, MATLAB, SAS, STATA, VBA, etc. Strong data wrangling/transformation skills- Strong knowledge of statistics, including hypothesis testing and linear models- Good working knowledge of SQL (writing queries, performing joins, etc.)- Experience with MySQL, Oracle, MS SQL Server, or any other common RDBMS- Excellent independent problem solving skills- Desire to learn new analytic tools and acquire in-depth knowledge of the Healthcare industry- Strong working knowledge of MS Office Suite, particularly Excel

    Preferred Skills:
  • Experience implementing and creating algorithms- Knowledge of HIPAA regulation and compliance- Knowledge of EDI X12 standards, including 837/835 and 270/271- Experience with AWS- Experience with R Shiny or similar- Experience with an ETL system like Talend- Work or internship experience in audit, consulting, or another professional services industry

    Qualifications:
  • Bachelors degree preferably in computer science, business, economics, statistics or a math-related major- 1+ years of experience in similar role with a focus in statistics and analytics (filters, unique calculations, queries, etc.) in a consulting firm or similar professional business setting- Keen aptitude in analyzing, interpreting and communicating outputs, including those of large data sets, from both internal client perspective- Strong written and oral communication skills- Professional presence- Organizational and time management skills; self-starter; independent worker
